cause a noise disturbance 2 construction of buildings and projects it shall be unlawful for any person within the city to operate equipment or perform any outside construction demolition alteration or repair work on buildings structures or projects or to operate any equipment including but not limited to any pile driver pneumatic hammer derrick hoist or other construction device during the nighttime or during the daytime in such a manner to cause a noise disturbance no permit shall be required in order to perform emergency work as defined in this article 3 hawkers and peddlers it shall be unlawful for any person within the city to sell or promote anything by outcry within any area of the city the provisions of this section shall not be construed to prohibit the selling by outcry of merchandise food and beverages at permitted or licensed sporting events parades fairs circuses and other similar permitted or licensed public entertainment events 4 horns signaling devices etc it shall be unlawful for any person within the city to make any sound from any horn bell or signaling device from any motor vehicle on any street alley roadway private or public way in the city or any stationary source except as a danger warning emergency signal devices and church bells are exempt from this section 5 loading and unloading commercial loading unloading opening closing of commercial vehicles or other handling of boxes crates containers building materials garbage cans or similar objects in such a manner as to cause a noise disturbance across a residential real property boundary is prohibited 6 loudspeakers public address systems the following are prohibited a using or operating for any noncommercial purpose any loudspeaker public address system or similar device such that the sound creates a noise disturbance across a real property boundary within or adjacent to any residentiallyzoned district or within 100 yards of any school during school hours b using or operating for any commercial purpose any loudspeaker public address system or similar device 1 such that the sound creates a noise disturbance across a real property boundary or within 100 yards of any school during school hours  or 2 between the hours of  pm and  am the following day on a public rightofway or public space 7 machinery power equipment fans and air conditioning it shall be unlawful for any person within the city to operate any air conditioning refrigerator heat pump fans swimming pool equipment or other equipment regardless of location in such a manner as to create a noise disturbance across a real property boundary 8 small power equipment it shall be unlawful to operate or permit the operation of any powered saw drill sander grinder lawn or garden tool lawn mower or similar device between the hours of  pm and  am the following day on weekends and local legal holidays and  pm and  am the following day on weekdays so as to cause a noise disturbance across a real property boundary and it is prohibited 9 public places adjacent to institutions of learning libraries hospitals and churches it shall be unlawful for any person within the city to create any sound on any street sidewalk or public place adjacent to any library institution of learning or church while the same is in use  or adjacent to any hospital which sound reasonably interferes with the workings of such institution or which disturbs or annoys patients in the hospital provided conspicuous signs are displayed in such streets sidewalks or public place indicating the presence of an institution of learning library church or hospital 10 radios television sets and similar devices it shall be unlawful for any person to use or operate any radio receiving set musical instrument phonograph television set or other machine or device for the producing or reproducing of sound in such a manner as to create a noise disturbance 11 refuse collection vehicles and equipment the collection of trash or refuse with a refuse vehicle or by the use of any type of motorized equipment during the nighttime is prohibited the phrase vehicle and equipment includes but is not limited to trash compactors gasoline powered blowers used also to collect clippings leaves or trash vacuum equipment and sweeping machines 12 engine repairs and testing it shall be unlawful for any person to repair rebuild or test any engine so as to create a noise disturbance 13 parked or standing motor vehicles it shall be unlawful to operate the auxiliary engine of a motor vehicle for more than ten minutes within any given hour when the vehicle is parked or is standing for other than traffic reasons so as to create a noise disturbance 14 operation of motor driven vehicles it shall be unlawful to operate a motor vehicle other than an authorized emergency vehicle or a vehicle moving under special permit which creates a noise disturbance 15 yelling shouting etc it shall be unlawful for any person to yell shout talk loudly whistle or sing on any public street or private property in the city at anytime so as to cause a noise disturbance this section shall not apply to any person who is participating in a duly permitted or licensed event or who has been duly authorized to engage in such conduct      maximum permissible sound pressure levels it shall be unlawful for any person to cause a sound from a stationary source requirement set forth in this article or in applicable regulations issued pursuant thereto the city manager may obtain a warrant or summons for the prosecution of such violation in addition if the agent is a duly qualified law enforcement officer of the city the city manager may issue a summons to or arrest without a warrant any person who in the presence of the officer violates this article nothing in this section shall be interpreted to restrict the right of any person to secure a summons or warrant for a violation of this article duly authorized magistrate b furthermore the city manager or an agent of the city manager may issue a notice of violation setting forth the alleged failures and advising the owner occupant operator or agent that such failures must be corrected such notice shall 1 be in writing  2 set forth the alleged violations of this article or of applicable regulations issued pursuant thereto  3 describe the premises where the violations are alleged to exist andor other identifications of the noise source  4 set forth a reasonable time within which any violation alleged is required to be corrected  5 be served upon the owner occupant or operator of the noise source or upon the agent of any of the foregoing by a personally delivering the same to such person  b mailing the same to such person by certified mail return receipt requested addressed to the last known place of residence of such person  or c posting same in or about the premises described in the notice if service under subsection b5a of this section cannot be effected at the end of the period of time allowed for correction of any violation alleged the city manager shall reinspect the noise source described in the notice      variance a any person responsible for any noise source may apply to the city manager for a variance or partial variance from the provisions of this article the application shall be accompanied by such information and data as the city manager may require the city manager may grant such variance or partial variance if such manager finds that 1 the potential danger to the community is outweighed by the benefit to the public interest during the period of variance  2 compliance with the provision of this article from which variance is sought would produce serious hardship without equal or greater benefits to the public b no variance or partial variance issued pursuant to this section shall be granted for a period to exceed one year but any such variance or partial variance may be renewed for like periods if after being duly considered at a hearing held by the city manager he finds that renewal is justified under subsection a of this section no renewal shall be granted except on application any such application shall be made at least 60 days prior to the expiration of the variance or partial variance any renewal granted pursuant to this subsection shall be on the same grounds and subject to the same limitations and requirements as provided in subsection a of this section c a variance partial variance or renewal thereof shall not be a right of the applicant or holder thereof but shall be in the discretion of the city manager    emergencies an exemption from the provisions of this article is automatically granted for noise caused in the performance of emergency work nothing in this section shall be construed to permit law enforcement ambulance fire or other emergency personnel to make excessive noise in the performance of their duties when such noise is clearly unnecessary    noise suppression devices a no person shall cause suffer allow or permit the removal disconnection or disabling of any noise suppression system or device which has been installed on any noise source 1 in accordance with federal or state laws or regulations  2 as a requirement for obtaining a permit to construct modify or install such noise source b no person shall defeat the purpose of any noise suppression system or device by installing or modifying therein or thereon any part or component which does not meet the minimum design specifications for that system or device c no noise source shall be operated with its noise suppression system or device removed or otherwise rendered inoperable or in disrepair    penalties  violations deemed nuisances a any person violating any of the provisions of this article shall be punished in accordance with subsection 2811 each day such violation is committed or permitted to continue shall constitute a separate offense and shall be punishable as such b as an additional remedy the operation or maintenance of devices instruments vehicles or machinery in violation of any provision of this article which operation or maintenance cause discomfort or annoyance to reasonable persons of normal sensitiveness or which endangers the comfort repose health or peace of residents in the area shall be deemed and is declared to be a public nuisance and may be subject to abatement summarily by a restraining order or injunction issued by a court of competent jurisdiction    secs 14581487  reserved article iv  reserved footnotes  3  editors note adopted mar 24 201 deleted art iv  14881499 outdoor lighting footnotes  4  cross reference buildings ch 6  condominiums  648 et seq  housing ch 22  outdoor advertising  2889  utilities ch 42  streets sidewalks and other public places ch 36  subdivisions ch 38  underground utilities  42231 et seq  zoning ch 48 state law reference authority to regulate outdoor lighting in certain areas virginia  152920 definitions the following words terms and phrases when used in this article shall have the meanings ascribed to them in this section except where the context clearly indicates a different meaning average illumination intensity means the average of meter readings in footcandles at grade level at several points all of which shall be the average of all points in the area of projected lighting pattern glare means the sensation produced by brightness within the visual field that is sufficiently greater than the luminance to which the eyes are adapted to cause annoyance discomfort or loss in visual performance and visibility glare direct means glare resulting from high brightness of insufficiently shielded light sources in the field of view emanating or reflecting from areas of high brightness glare disability means glare which reduces visual performance and visibility and which is often accompanied by discomfort glare reflected means glare resulting from spectacular reflections of high brightness in polished or glossy surfaces in the field of view it is usually associated with reflections within a visual task of areas in close proximity to the region being viewed grade level means the average natural topographical elevation or average elevation established either by earth grading or hardsurfacing at which the major portion of the adjacent site area lies  except that no specially constructed or graded area ornamental or protective earthwork or raised landscape areas shall be determinant of ground level height the height of a light source shall be the measured vertical distance between the light source and the grade level the height of a light structure shall be the vertical distance between the uppermost extremity of any light structure pole supporting member or structural or nonstructural trim and the grade level light source means a single artificial point source of luminescence that emits measurable radiant energy within the visible spectrum measurement of intensity where the average intensity of artificial illumination is determinable it shall be measured in footcandles vertically or horizontally corrected for the angle of incident from grade level spillage means any light flux or diffusion glare or other artificial light emission onto any adjoining property above a defined maximum intensity as specified in section 14131    cross reference definitions and rules of construction  12 purpose and intent of article it is the purpose and intent of this article to prevent the creation of nuisance caused by unnecessary intensity of artificial illumination of property and buildings to promote the safety and general welfare of the public by the regulation of glare producing sources of light and to ensure the required minimum illumination to facilitate enforcement of law    zoning districts where required  exception  compliance with article outdoor lighting shall be required in all zoning districts with the exception of r1a r1b rth and shall meet the requirements of this article    permits a prior to the issuance of a permit for the installation of exterior light sources a plan and elevation to scale shall be prepared in duplicate and submitted to the zoning administrator such drawing shall depict the proposed number specific locations intensity projected lighting patterns style of fixtures and type of illumination of all light sources the plans submitted in compliance hereto shall not be deemed sufficient to fulfill the requirements of the building code but are in addition thereto all plans and elevations shall be prepared to show conformity with this article and shall be certified by a registered engineer registered electrical contractor architect or other such licensed person qualified to make such certification b approval of an application for an outdoor lighting permit by the planning commission shall be required whenever it 1 is in conjunction with a site plan or pud plan application submitted under the zoning regulations 2 is for an area of greater than one acre 43560 square feet 3 is proposed for an installation of greater than 25 fixtures 4 includes common lighting proposed for two or more establishments of different ownership 5 is requested for an outdoor recreation or assembly area as governed by section 14140 c any and all exterior artificial light sources requiring a permit and not having specific special regulations shall be governed by the provisions of this article d no zoning application or permit shall be required for the installation of any exterior light sources permitted in residential districts r1a r1b and rth except as specified in section 14135 this subsection shall not in any way impair the validity of the requirements of the building code e no application or permit shall be required for warning lights to be erected in conjunction with construction excavation maintenance repair etc as required by sections 3612 and 3670 all exterior light sources installed erected or maintained under this subsection shall be subject to section 14129 f all installations shall conform where applicable to chapters 6 and 36 as certified by the division of inspections and zoning administrator g no permit shall be required of the city or the state or of any public utility corporation when performing contractual arrangements for the city or state for the installation of any light source except as provided for in chapter 42 and subject to the provisions of section 14131 h when a public utility has contracted for the installation of outdoor lighting with a private concern a lighting permit is required and the application filed with the zoning administrator the public utility is exempt from all the provisions of chapter 6 i prior to the approval of a certificate of occupancy for any establishment having previously permitted exterior light sources requiring a permit under this article an application shall be submitted in the same form as that required for new light sources approval of a certificate of occupancy shall be contingent upon approval of an outdoor light permit    cross reference business professional occupational licenses  40456 et seq spillage control a all light sources installed erected or maintained in any district shall be shielded or directed so as to confine the area of diffusion to the property which it is intended to illuminate no light source shall be maintained in any manner or located where it creates a nuisance to the users of adjoining properties nor shall any light source remain erected which would create a traffic hazard spillage of light exceeding 0110 footcandles measured at any point seven feet beyond a property line shall be prohibited unless otherwise specified in this article b whenever a contiguous property is compatibly illuminated and is in business or commercial use subsection a of this section may be waived    prohibited installations the following shall be prohibited throughout all districts and in conjunction with all uses within the city unless otherwise provided 1 any artificial light source exceeding 45 feet in height above grade level 2 any permanent festoon lighting or any light source suspended from wires cables tubes or ropes that are subject to noticeable movements from wind or weather related conditions 3 any artificial light source which creates glare observable within the normal range of vision from any public walk thoroughfare or contiguous property under normal weather conditions 4 bare fluorescent tubes neon tubes incandescent bulbs or unprotected gas lamps 5 display of intermittent lights or any flashing blinking or moving lights or beacon or search lights except as required by state or federal law 6 any artificial light source or supporting structure installed over any street or sidewalk except as otherwise provided by section 365      sources deemed accessory uses any exterior light source and accompanying structural support shall be deemed an accessory use in all zoning districts    existing systems this article shall also apply to existing systems    r1a district exterior light sources shall not be permitted in an r1a onefamily residence district with the exception of the following 1 no artificial light source shall create a nuisance observable within the normal range of vision from a public walk or thoroughfare or contiguous property 2 floodlighting of single double or triplecluster type shall be limited to 150 watts per light source to be so directed or shielded to confine the area of illumination to the immediate property the number of floodlights shall not exceed five per residence property 3 porch portico and doorway light sources shall be so directed or shielded to confine the area of light to the entranceway 4 festive lighting of a temporary nature shall be erected no more than three days before and shall be removed no later than three days after the activity or event when the festive lighting denotes celebration of a recognized national legal or religious celebration these periods shall be extended to cover such time as is customarily appropriate to the celebration but in no instance to exceed a total time lapse of 30 days 5 all exterior light sources shall also be regulated by the provisions of section 14132    r1b district exterior light sources shall not be permitted in an r1b one family residence district except for those permitted in and regulated by the r1a district provisions    rth townhouse district exterior light sources shall not be permitted in an rth townhouse district with the exception of the following 1 any exterior light sources permitted in and regulated by the r1b district provisions 2 lighting of any common green space provided in compliance with shall be properly shielded as required in section 14131    rm general residence district exterior light sources shall not be permitted in an rm general residence district with the exception of the following 1 the average intensity of illumination of offstreet parking areas shall not exceed 50 footcandles 2 such lighting of yards walkways gardens and entranceways as required for the safety and wellbeing of the tenants may be provided but shall not exceed an average illumination of 50 footcandles 3 no light source extending above any parking area street alley driveway or other area intended for the use of motor vehicles shall be less than 16 feet in height unless the structural support is surrounded at grade level by a sixinch concrete header curb at a minimum radial distance of four feet in which instance a light source may be a minimum height of eight feet above the traveled surface where this lower minimum is utilized there shall be no projections arms davits or other supporting structures nor any light source extending to within three feet of any vehicular traffic lane aisle or driveway nothing in this subsection shall prohibit driveway lighting properly screened to prevent glare and spillage and not exceeding a height of 24 inches from being erected provided it is protected by a sixinch concrete header curb and is at least three feet from any traffic lane parking aisle or driveway 4 festive or temporary lighting shall be governed by the provisions of section 141354    t1 transitional district exterior light sources shall not be permitted in a t1 transitional district except for those permitted in and regulated by the rm district provisions    other districts and uses all zoning districts and uses not otherwise provided for shall be regulated by the following 1 side and rear service yards a side and rear yards of all buildings shall be lighted during the period from onehalf hour before sunset to onehalf hour after sunrise such light sources shall be shielded and mounted on the walls of the building in the immediate area of each service or exit door and at a height not less than 16 feet above grade level no light source required by this subsection shall be erected at a height greater than the roof cornice line or 45 feet whichever is the lesser b wallmounted floodlights or spotlights installed to provide general illumination of the service area shall be prohibited unless installed in such a manner as to prevent glare from the light source being visible from any adjacent property c illumination in the vicinity of each service or exit door shall be a minimum average of 50 footcandles the maximum illumination at grade level shall not exceed 100 footcandles 2 parking areas a average intensity of illumination of parking areas shall be limited to 100 footcandles in all other respects parking areas shall be regulated by section 14131 and section 141383 b no light source shall be mounted at a height greater than 45 feet nor shall any portion of the lighting structure exceed that height c freestanding structures shall be mounted on or in concrete bases of sufficient size and strength to adequately support the structures and fixtures without the use of guy wires d the illumination level of entrances into offstreet parking areas and exits onto public thoroughfares shall not exceed 100 footcandles 3 automobile service stations a artificial illumination of pump islands shall not exceed a maximum level of illumination of 20 footcandles with light sources shielded and directed downward all structures and fixtures for the purpose of illuminating pump islands shall be located thereon b in general service areas the maximum illumination at grade level shall not exceed 100 footcandles  provided that fixtures for such illumination are shielded and directed downward in such manner to prevent the source of light from being visible within the normal angle of vision from any public walk or thoroughfare c the illumination level of entrances and exits from and onto public thoroughfares shall be governed by subsection 2d of this section 4 outdoor sales areas a all lighting sources shall be contained within shielding devices directed in such a manner to prevent the source of light from being visible within the normal angle of vision from any public walk or thoroughfare b the maximum average illuminating intensity at grade level shall not exceed 100 footcandles average of area c whenever the movement of onsite vehicles is inherent in the arrangement of display the provisions of section 141383 shall apply 5 canopy lighting artificial illumination of sidewalk areas beneath canopies where intended for use by the general public shall be limited to a maximum of 50 footcandles directly under the canopy at grade level 6 building illumination a nothing in this article shall prohibit the artificial illumination of building facades statues monuments and foundations or other such ornamental structures  provided that such illumination is achieved by the use of shielded lamps or fixtures which shall direct illumination only onto the subject to be illuminated b light sources for such illumination shall be mounted at sufficient height to prevent the source of light from being visible within the normal angle of vision and so positioned to prevent the source of light from being visible from any public walk or thoroughfare the height of the light source shall not exceed 45 feet or onehalf the actual building height whichever is the lesser except when the light source is directed downward to the base of the structure and is situated wholly within an overhanging roofline projection or decorative parapet wall enclosure constructed of materials compatible with the building facade c whenever such light source is mounted on or within six feet of the grade level it shall be effectively screened by dense evergreens or other decorative means to prevent the source of light from being visible from any public walk or thoroughfare 7 sign illumination all signs illuminated in any manner shall conform to the restriction limitations and prohibitions of both the general provisions of this article and such other regulations in chapter 48 article vi pertaining to signs 8 festive or temporary lighting a all temporary or festive lighting shall be subject to the general provisions of this article as well as any special regulations by the district in which it is located in addition all festive and temporary lighting shall conform to section 141354 b all lighting erected in conjunction with any carnival or outdoor assembly shall comply with section 641 9 outdoor recreation or assembly a artificial illumination of any outdoor recreation or assembly area or facility shall conform to the provisions of section 14131 and the general prohibitions of section 14132 except subsection 1 of such section b the height limit of section 141321 shall apply to all outdoor recreation or assembly areas or facilities except when this limitation is considered inappropriate because of the nature of the existing or intended use of such areas or facilities or because of considerations of safety in such instance an application may be made to the planning commission for permission to erect such lighting at a height suitable to the special nature of the use area or facility the planning commission may approve such application with any stipulations they deem necessary and make such a condition to the granting of the permit subject to the general requirements of section 14130 violation of stipulations shall be grounds for revocation of such permit    appeals a except for instances relating to projecting light sources or supporting structures located or proposed to be located on or over public property any person who has been ordered by the zoning administrator to incur an expense for the alteration or removal of light sources or supporting structures or any person whose application for a permit for a light source or supporting structure has been refused may appeal to the board of zoning appeals by serving written notice to the zoning administrator and electrical inspector such appeal may be transmitted to the board of zoning appeals upon the filing of a notice of appeal the electrical inspector shall take no further action with regard to the light source or supporting structure involved until the final decision of either board has been rendered unless the electrical inspector or zoning administrator finds that the light source or supporting structure involved by reason of its condition presents an immediate and serious danger to the public in which instance the electrical inspector shall proceed immediately b the board of zoning appeals pursuant to the same powers and authority and in accordance with the same procedures of sections 48172 and 48173 may only grant variances of siting height and light sources    enforcement of article a the zoning administrator shall make inspections and tests necessary to obtain compliance with the provisions of this article and shall have absolute right of entry upon any premises for inspection between the hours of  am and  pm on normal working days in all cases the inspector shall present proper identification to and request entry from the owner or occupant of the premises if entry is refused the inspector showing reasonable cause to believe the existence of a violation shall apply to the bailing justice or municipal court for a warrant authorizing entry b the zoning administrator shall revoke any outdoor lighting permit which violates any provision of this article or of this or which has been secured by subterfuge or is void or which has been issued by mistake misunderstanding or error by the city c all rights and privileges required under the provisions of this article or any amendments thereto are mere licenses revocable at any time by the zoning administrator and all such permits shall contain this provision d every light source or supporting structure unlawfully placed upon or projecting within at least three feet from a public rightofway or unlawfully on public property or declared to be hazardous or unsafe by the zoning administrator is hereby declared to be a public nuisance e the zoning administrator shall issue a violation notice and order in writing for violation of this article a violation notice may be issued without an order to comply or may order compliance and grant a time limit for compliance f the notice and order shall be deemed to give actual notice if given in either or all the following manners 1 by handling in person either to the owner or occupant of the premises on which the light source is located the owner of the light source the person responsible for the light source or the permittee  and the time for compliance with the order shall start from the date of notice 2 registered mail return receipt requested addressed to either or all of the persons described in subsection f1 of this section to addresses shown on the commissioner of the revenues current records or as shown on the permit  and the time for compliance with the order shall start on the date of receipt of delivery 3 by posting on the light source or on the supporting structure or on the premises  and time for compliance shall start on the date of posting    violation  penalty a any person virginia  226141 as amended to accept payment of local taxes and other fees penalties and interest by the use of any commercially acceptable means including but not limited to checks credit cards debit cards and electronic funds transfer and may add to any amount due a sum not to exceed the amount charged to the city for acceptance of any payment by a means that incurs a charge to the city or capable of cooperating with the city for the collection of local taxes and other fees and to establish a list of credit cards so determined that may be accepted for payment of local taxes and other fees penalties and interest b if any credit card transaction tendered for payment of any tax or other fee penalty and interest due is not paid by the bank or credit card company the taxpayer for whom such credit card transaction was tendered shall remain liable for the payment of the tax or other fee penalty and interest the same as if such credit card transaction had not been tendered c a penalty of $5000 shall be imposed for the uttering publishing or passing of any check draft or order for payment of taxes or any other sums due the city which is subsequently returned for insufficient funds the amount due whichever shall be greater such penalty shall be added to the amount of the account due from such person no penalty shall be imposed for the failure to pay any account if such failure fire marshalcreation of office  appointments  powers and duties  compensation  term the office of city fire marshal is hereby established the council may upon recommendation of the city manager appoint the city fire marshal and assistant fire marshals the term fire marshal as used in this chapter may include the local fire official and local arson investigator when appointed pursuant to this section the fire marshal shall have such powers and duties as are prescribed by this chapter and as authorized by the virginia the city fire marshal shall receive such annual salary as the city manager may allow the city fire marshal shall not be appointed for a definite tenure but shall continue contingent upon and subject to the personnel rules of the city  oaths of office the city fire marshal and the assistant city fire marshals before entering upon their duties shall respectively take an oath before any officer authorized to administer oaths to faithfully discharge the duties of their respective offices  notification of fire department in any building structure or premises subject to inspection under any provision of this chapter when a fire or evidence of there having been a fire is discovered even though it has apparently been extinguished it shall be immediately reported to the local emergency communications center  911 this shall be the duty of the owner manager or person in control as defined herein of such building structure or premises at the time of discovery this requirement shall not be construed to forbid or otherwise restrict the owner manager or person in control of said building structure or premises from using all diligence necessary to extinguish such fire prior to the arrival of the fire department  investigation of fires the city fire marshal shall investigate or cause to be investigated every fire or explosion occurring within the city that is of a suspicious nature or which involves the loss of life causes injury to persons or causes destruction of or damage to property such investigation shall be made at the time of the fire or at a subsequent time depending on the nature and circumstances of the fire the city fire marshal shall also investigate or cause to be investigated the possession or manufacture of explosive devices substances and fire bombs within the city attempts or threats to commit such offenses and false alarms relating to such offenses or to fires or explosions the city fire marshal shall take charge immediately of the physical evidence and in order to preserve any physical evidence relating to the cause or origin of such fire or explosion take means to prevent access by any person or persons to such building structure or premises until such evidence has been properly processed the city of falls church police department upon request of the city fire marshal shall assist in the investigation as needed the results of any such investigation shall be forwarded by the fire marshal to the commonwealths attorney for proper disposition  powers of arrest a the city fire marshal and the assistant city fire marshals permitted under virginia tit 27 195 as amended shall have the same police powers as a member of the city of falls church police department in the investigation and prosecution of all offenses involving fires arson fire bombings bombings attempts or threats to commit such offenses false alarms relating to such offenses possession and manufacture of explosive devices substances and fire bombs the storage use and transportation of hazardous materials and hazardous waste environmental crimes and any other offenses involving fire or fire safety or the calling causing to dispatch or summonsing of fire or rescue equipment without just cause in violation of the virginia 195 as amended or the the city of falls church and other criminal or civil offenses arising out of or incidental to the investigation of the enumerated offenses b the county fire marshal assistant fire marshals and authorized deputy fire marshals or designees shall have the authority to exercise all those powers described in virginia  27342 and 2734 195 as amended c the police powers granted in this section shall not be exercised by any fire marshal until such person has met the requirements of virginia  27342 and 2734 195 as amended and has been designated by the city fire marshal to exercise such powers  summoning or dispatching the city fire marshal the fire department officerincharge of any fire or explosion within the city of falls church shall immediately summon or cause to be dispatched the city fire marshal to the scene to investigate the circumstances involved  effect of repeal of chapter  revival neither the adoption of this chapter nor the repeal hereby of the prior fire codes or ordinances shall in any manner affect the prosecution for violations of this chapter which violations were committed prior to the effective date hereof nor be construed as a waiver of any permit fees or penalty at the effective date due and unpaid under such ordinance nor be construed as affecting any of the provisions of such code relating to the collection of any such permit fees or penalty or the penal provisions applicable to any violation thereof nor to affect the validity of any bond or cash deposit in lieu thereof required to be posted filed or deposited pursuant to any ordinance and all rights and obligations thereof appertaining shall continue in full force and effect any repeal of the fire prevention code shall not be construed as reviving such former ordinance clause or provision unless expressly provided therein  penalty and continuing violation a any person owner firm entity or corporation who violates any sections of this chapter fails to comply with any provisions of the city of falls church fire prevention of the virginia statewide fire prevention or violates or fails to comply with any order made thereunder or who fails to comply with such an order within the time fixed therein shall separately for each and every such violation and noncompliance respectively be guilty of a violation of this chapter and upon conviction be punishable as a class 1 misdemeanor in accordance with virginia law including by imprisonment for not more than 12 months andor a fine of not more than $250000 each day that a violation continues after service of notice as provided for in the virginia statewide fire prevention shall be deemed a separate offense b the imposition of the criminal penalties herein prescribed shall not preclude the city from enforcing any administrative remedies set forth elsewhere in this chapter or the the city of falls church virginia as amended or preclude the city from instituting appropriate civil action including but not limited to injunction to restrain correct or otherwise abate a violation of this chapter the suspension or revocation of any license permit certificate or other privilege conferred by the city shall not be regarded as a penalty  fines and costs the city fire marshal shall recover or impose fees and penalties for fire department response to the location of a false faulty or nuisance alarm as used herein the term false alarm also means a faulty or nuisance alarm  authority to adopt set and modify fees by city council the city manager in consultation with the city fire marshal shall recommend and the city council shall adopt a schedule of fees to be paid for each application permit inspectionreinspection testing and other specified acts required by this chapter any fee authorized or referenced herein other than fees for false alarm response shall be established in this manner  unlawful or prohibited acts include causing permitting concealing whenever in this chapter any act or omission is made unlawful or prohibited it shall include causing allowing permitting aiding abetting suffering or concealing the fact of such act or omission  damage or injury to fire department vehicles equipment or personnel it shall be unlawful for any person to damage deface attempt or conspire to damage or deface any fire department vehicle or equipment at anytime or to injure or attempt or conspire to injure any fire department personnel while such personnel are in performance of their departmental duties  unlawful boarding or tampering with fire department vehicles it shall be unlawful for any person without proper authorization from the officer in charge of the vehicle to attempt or to cling to attach oneself to climb upon or into board or swing upon any fire department vehicle whether such vehicle is in motion or at rest or to sound any warning device thereon or to manipulate tamper with remove or destroy any lever valve switch starting device brake pump or any equipment protective clothing tool or any part of such fire department vehicle andor property  impersonation and solicitation by use of the city of falls church fire marshal name it shall be unlawful for any unauthorized person to use a badge uniform or any other credentials so as to gain access to any building marine vessel vehicle or premises or to otherwise falsely identify himself as the fire marshal code official fire official or fire code official or hisher designated representative the use of the name of the city of falls church fire marshal for any purpose of solicitation or to imply that any solicited funds will be used for the city of falls church is prohibited and shall be subject to the penalties of this chapter  unlawful to cross fire line it shall be unlawful for any person to cross or to remain within designated fire lines or barricades which have been established to prevent public access to the scene of fires wrecks explosions crimes andor emergency situations where life limb location #4  underground storage tanks for class i flammable liquids or class ii or iii combustible liquids and related piping shall not be permitted directly over a subsurface structure or within 25 feet measured horizontally from the outside wall of such subsurface structure underground storage tanks and related piping for class i flammable liquids or class ii or iii combustible liquids located in an area between 25 and 100 feet measured horizontally from the outside wall of a subsurface structure where the tops of such tanks and piping are not 2 feet or more below the lowest point of contents of the tank access shall be provided in the vault top for inspection monitoring and servicing of the vault and tank spfc21 service stations in proximity of subsurface structures add the a1011 scope a fire watch is a temporary measure intended to ensure continuous and systematic surveillance of a building structure or portion thereof by one 1 or more qualified individuals for the purposes of identifying and controlling fire hazards detecting early signs of unwanted fire raising an alarm of fire and immediately notifying the 911  emergency communications center a1021 initiation in the event that a fire protection system sprinkler system alarm detection or other suppression system is impaired or out of service a fire watch shall be instituted by the person in control as defined in of the falls church city  a1022 procedures when the establishment of a fire watch is initiated by the person in control or ordered by the fire department or fire official the owner or the owners representative shall implement the following procedures for the duration of the fire watch the fire watch shall be maintained until such time the noted systems is returned to normal ready service and approved for use by the fire official 1 a fire watch shall consist of the following a a designated number of staff minimum of two personnel performing fire watch duties at all times and until the fire protection system has been repaired inspected tested and certified to be placed back in service during the duration of a fire watch the sole duty of such designated staff shall be the fire watch b each participating staff member shall be equipped with reliable twoway system of communications c one 1 staff member shall always be stationed in an area or room equipped with a working telephone or cellular phone to report a fire smoke or other hazardous situation by dialing 911 note when dialing 911 from a cellular phone some cellular phone systems may connect user with another jurisdictions emergency communications center therefore the caller should confirm they are speaking with the emergency communications center serving the city of falls church virginia d at least one 1 staff member shall conduct a walking tour of all areas of the building no less than every fifteen 15 minutes to look for fire smoke or hazardous situations that require fire department response  or e a complete tour of the facility within a time frame prescribed by the fire official or fire department and with the fire watch staffing level contingent upon the size of the facility and the type of occupancy note if the building or property is of such size that two 2 individuals cannot adequately perform the required fire watch  the fire department representative may require additional onsite personnel to participate in the fire watch upon request the fire department representative may permit one 1 person to perform the fire watch if the building or property is size that one 1 person can adequately perform the required fire watch 2 a legibly written log shall be kept on site at all times for review by any fire department employee documenting a the reason the fire watch was implemented b the date and time the fire department was notified the fire watch was initiated and concluded c the start and stop time of each building or property tour d the key locations visited in the buildings requiring the fire watch e names of personnel conducting the fire watch f names of personnel recording the information g log entries shall be kept for a minimum of two 2 years 3 personnel conducting the fire watch shall be a capable of performing patrol duties b reliable and not under the influence of intoxicants or illegal substances c able to clearly and accurately converse with fire department personnel in english in the event of an emergency d able to remain awake and alert at all times note in all cases the sole duty of personnel assigned to the fire watch shall be to perform constant patrols of the protected premises to keep watch for fires and if necessary to summon the fire department 4 in the event of a fire emergency a the fire watch staff shall immediately call 911 and report the location of the fire within the building b activate the emergency alarm signal if available c begin the evacuation of the building starting on the fire floor then above the fire floor then below the fire floor all questions concerning the fire watch shall be directed to the falls church fire marshal normal business hours at 703 2485058 and the falls church emergency communications center after hours at 703 2415053    secs 18201840  reserved health and sanitation footnotes  1  cross reference animals ch 4  air pollution  1420 et seq  fire prevention ch 18  food and food service 2012018  reserved article ii  health footnotes  2  state law reference health virginia  3211 et seq definitions the following words terms and phrases when used in this article shall have the meanings ascribed to them in this section except where the context clearly indicates a different meaning city manager means the city manager of the city of falls church virginia director of health means the fairfax county director of health or such directors designee responsible for enforcement of this article citys contract with the county of fairfax disposal means the discharge deposit injection dumping spilling leaking or placing of any solid waste into or on any land or water so that such solid waste or any constituent thereof may enter the environment or be emitted into the air or discharged into any waters including groundwaters hazardous waste means a solid waste or combination of solid waste which because of its quantity concentration or physical chemical or infectious characteristics may 1 cause or significantly contribute to an increase in mortality or an increase in serious irreversible or incapacitating illness  or 2 pose a substantial present or potential hazard to human health or the environment when improperly treated stored transported disposed of or otherwise managed occupant includes the lessee of vacant land public health or safety menace means any condition which might endanger the health or safety of the public including but not limited to 1 unsanitary or improper storage or disposal of trash garbage refuse debris other solid waste or hazardous waste  2 unburied dead animals  3 accumulation of water causing mosquito or other vector breeding or proliferation  4 rodent or insect infestation  5 accumulation of bees fowl or animals in such a manner to create a condition that may be injurious to the public health or safety  6 hazards such as open excavations open wells pits or parts thereof in danger of falling discarded refrigerators and freezers with doors attached unsecured vacant structures or habitation for bats wasps or other venomous pests  7 garbage which is not contained in a watertight rodentproof container which is equipped with a tightfitting lid  8 improper disposal of medical dental veterinary or pharmaceutical equipment or supplies including but not limited to syringes needles scalpels and blades or other medicinal items in solid or liquid form in such a manner as to make it possible for any other person to retrieve and utilize said equipment or supplies  9 any other condition that may be injurious to the public health or safety sanitary landfill means a disposal facility for solid waste so located designed and operated that it does not pose a substantial present or potential hazard to human health or the environment including pollution of air land surface water or groundwater solid waste 1 the term solid waste means any garbage refuse sludge and other discarded material including solid liquid semisolid or contained gaseous material resulting from industrial commercial mining and agricultural operations and from community activities 2 the term solid waste does not include a solid or dissolved material in domestic sewage  b solid or dissolved material in irrigation return flows or in industrial discharges which are sources subject to a permit from the state water control board  or c source special nuclear or byproduct material as defined by the federal atomic energy act of 195 as amended cross reference definitions and rules of construction  12 health or safety menacesinspection the director of health is authorized to inspect occupied or vacant land or premises to ascertain the existence of health or safety menaces on such land or premises the director of health shall inspect the land or premises at reasonable daylight times in a reasonable manner if the owner or occupant of the land or premises denies the director of health free access for such purposes the director of health may inspect after obtaining a search warrant sameabatement a when any condition that constitutes a public health or safety menace is found on occupied or vacant land or premises the director of health shall notify in writing the owner or occupant of the land or premises on which the condition exists andor any other person who the director of health believes is responsible for the health or safety menace such notice shall contain a description of the health or safety menace  the time within which the menace shall be abated corrected or eliminated  and a statement that the owner occupant or other person responsible may request a hearing within ten days of the receipt of the notice notice sent by registered or certified mail to the lastknown address of the owner whose name is shown on the current real estate tax assessment records or the occupant or other identified person responsible shall be deemed compliance with the notice requirement to the person responsible b upon receipt of the written notice from the director of health the owner occupant or other person responsible shall abate correct or eliminate the health or safety menace the time allowed to abate correct or eliminate the health or safety menace condition shall be determined by the director of health and shall not be less than 24 hours nor more than ten days if the director of health determines that the menace cannot be abated corrected or eliminated within ten days the director of health may order temporary abatement measures and allow a longer period of time to abate correct or eliminate the condition the director of health may allow such a longer period of time only upon request of the owner occupant or other person responsible and only upon a goodfaith showing that such longer period of time is necessary samefailure to abate a after receipt of the written notice it is unlawful for the owner occupant or other person responsible to fail to abate correct or eliminate the health or safety menace within the time determined by the director of health b if the written notice is undeliverable or if after receipt of the written notice the owner occupant or other person responsible fails to abate correct or eliminate the health or safety menace the director of health may request the city department of environmental services to take reasonable steps to abate correct or eliminate the health or safety menace whether the land or premises are occupied or vacant if the owner occupant or other person responsible denies free access for such purposes the director of health may proceed after obtaining a warrant costs and expenses incurred by the director of health or the city department of environmental services abating correcting or eliminating a health or safety menace on private property shall be assessed against the owner andor occupant of the land or premises andor any other person responsible for the health or safety menace and shall be recoverable from the owner in the same way as taxes and levies costs and expenses incurred by the director of health in abating correcting or eliminating a health or safety menace on public property shall be recoverable from the person responsible for causing the health or safety menace hearing and appeals procedure in the absence of an emergency the city department of environmental services may abate correct or eliminate the health or safety menace only after providing the owner occupant or other person responsible an opportunity to be heard such a hearing request shall be made within ten days after receipt by the owner occupant or other person responsible of the notice to abate correct or eliminate the health or safety menace in the case of an emergency the director of health may request the city department of environmental services to take reasonable steps to abate correct or eliminate the health or safety menace without providing the owner occupant or other person responsible an opportunity to be heard until after the health or safety menace is abated corrected or eliminated in such an emergency the hearing request shall be made within ten days after the condition is abated corrected or eliminated all hearing requests shall be in writing and directed to the general manager for the city department of environmental services who shall forward the requests to the city manager within two days of receipt all hearings shall be before the city manager or the city managers designee the city manager or the designee of the city manager shall set a time and place for the hearing which shall occur within ten days of the request for the hearing and shall so notify the director of health and the appellant after the hearing the city manager or the designee of the city manager may order the appellant to abate correct or eliminate the health or safety menace in the same manner as the director of health may require any person who fails refuses or neglects to comply with any such order shall be guilty of violating the provisions of this article penalty if after receipt of the written notice or an order from the city manager or the designee of the city manager the owner occupant or other person responsible refuses or neglects to abate correct or eliminate the condition as required such individual shall upon conviction be guilty of a class 1 misdemeanor further each day any violations of this article shall continue shall constitute a separate offense housing footnotes  1  charter reference authority of city to regulate housing  204 cross  in general secs 2212218  reserved article ii  housing commission establishment  functions there is hereby established a housing commission the commission shall 1 in accordance with city goals and objectives maintain awareness of housing needs and opportunities in the city 2 investigate and prepare appropriate housing policy initiatives and changes for recommendation to the council 3 perform the functions of the commission as specified in article iv of this chapter 4 mediate or arbitrate conflicts arising out of the application of the virginia residential landlord and tenant act as specified in article v of this chapter 5 offer reconciliatory services in conflicts arising out of article iv division 3 and article vi division 6 of chapter 48 pertaining to zoning the virginia condominium act and the united states housing and community development act 6 coordinate its activities with other city commissions having a related interest 7 perform such additional functions as are listed herein or which may be assigned by the council      composition  organization  staffing a the commission shall be appointed by the city council and consist of five members it is the intent of this article that the interests of both landlords and tenants shall be represented equally on the commission the members shall be appointed for a term of three years  provided that of the members first appointed one shall be appointed for a term of one year each one shall be appointed for a term of two years each and three shall be appointed for terms of three years each any vacancy shall be filled by the city council for the unexpired portion of a term of office all members shall be residents of the city b the commission shall elect a chairperson from among its members and shall do so annually within two months of the selection of fullterm members three members of the commission shall constitute a quorum and decisions of the commission shall be made by a majority of the members present the commission shall meet at least quarterly meetings shall be at the call of the chairperson or of three members of the commission after notice to all members or upon request of the city council the commission shall maintain records of its proceedings c the commission shall have the assistance of staff designated by the city manager hereinafter referred to as the staff representative the commission shall be provided additional staff as deemed necessary and may call upon special consultants for assistance when needed the commission shall likewise have the assistance of the city attorney as needed in its deliberations and proceedings      submission and processing of complaints complaints shall be submitted and processed pursuant to the procedures rules and regulations provided in articles iv and v of this chapter and those which the commission shall establish from time to time after consultation with the city attorney the commission may make issue adopt promulgate amend and rescind such rules and regulations as it deems necessary to carry out its responsibilities under this chapter    additional functions in addition to its duties as outlined in this article the commission may engage in such of the following functions as in its judgment will further the housing goals of the city 1 make studies with respect to a housing practices in the city generally and in its various neighborhoods including the practices of multifamily apartment complexes with respect to low and moderateincome tenants b the availability of housing for low and moderateincome persons and those who are handicapped c the availability of rental housing 2 prepare recommendation for the citys annual community development block grant program 3 initiate action and cooperate with others in action designed to a prevent or eliminate discrimination in housing and to encourage fair housing b improve landlordtenant relations c assist property owners and property owners associations in resolving problems unique to individuals living in cluster housing and condominiums 4 assist tenants and property owners to resolve problems arising from conversions to condominiums and cooperatives 5 recommend desired housing related legislation to be presented to the city council for consideration 6 disseminate information concerning the various laws and ordinances relative to housing and promote compliance with them      disclosure of information a unless the parties agree in writing to prior disclosure all information relevant to a complaint under this article shall be held confidential until reconciliation is reached a public hearing is initiated or the proceedings of the commission are concluded b nothing in this article shall contravene the virginia freedom of information act    other remedies nothing herein shall prevent any person from exercising any rights or seeking any remedy to which that person might otherwise be entitled    secs 22252251  reserved article iii  rent for fair housing throughout the city to all persons regardless of race color religion marital status national origin sex elderliness familial status or handicap and to that end to prohibit discriminatory practices with respect to residential housing by any person or group of persons in order that the peace health safety prosperity and general welfare of all the inhabitants of the city may be protected and ensured    unlawful discriminatory housing practices a it shall be an unlawful discriminatory housing practice for any person having the right to sell rent lease control construct or manage any dwelling constructed or to be constructed or any agent independent contractor or employee of such person 1 to refuse to sell or rent after the making of a bona fide offer or to refuse to negotiate for the sale or rental of or otherwise make unavailable or deny a dwelling to any person because of race color religion marital status national origin sex elderliness familial status or handicap  2 to discriminate against any person in the terms conditions or privileges of sale or rental of a dwelling or in the provision of services or facilities in the connection therewith to any person because of race color religion marital status national origin sex elderliness familial status or handicap  3 to make print or publish or cause to be made printed or published any notice statement or advertisement with respect to the sale or rental of a dwelling that indicates any preference limitation or discrimination or an intention to make any such preference limitation or discrimination based on race color religion marital status national origin sex elderliness familial status or handicap the use of words or symbols associated with a particular religion marital status national origin sex or race shall be prima facie evidence of an illegal preference under this article which shall not be overcome by a general disclaimer  4 to represent to any person because of race color religion marital status national origin sex elderliness familial status or handicap that any dwelling is not available for inspection sale or rental when such dwelling is in fact so available  5 to deny any person access to membership in or participation in any multiple listing service real estate brokers organization or other service organization or facility relating to the business of selling or renting dwellings or to discriminate against such person in the terms or conditions of such access membership or participation because of race color religion marital status national origin sex elderliness familial status or handicap  6 to include in any transfer sale rental or lease of housing any restrictive covenant that discriminates because of race color religion marital status national origin sex elderliness financial status or handicap or for any person to honor or exercise or attempt to honor or exercise any such discriminatory covenant pertaining to housing  7 to induce or attempt to induce to sell or rent any dwelling by representations regarding the entry or prospective entry into the neighborhood of a person or persons of a particular race color religion marital status national origin sex elderliness familial status or handicap  8 to refuse to sell or rent or refuse to negotiate for the sale or rental of or otherwise discriminate or make unavailable or deny a dwelling because of a handicap of a the buyer or renter  b a person residing in or intending to reside in that dwelling after it is so sold rented or made available  or c any person associated with the buyer or renter  9 to discriminate against any person in the terms conditions or privileges of sale or rental of a dwelling or in the provision of services or facilities in connection therewith because of a handicap of a that person  b a person residing in or intending to reside in that dwelling after it was so sold rented or made available  or c any person associated with that buyer or renter  b for the purpose of this section the term discrimination includes 1 a refusal to permit at the expense of the handicapped person reasonable modifications of existing premises occupied or to be occupied by any person if such modifications may be necessary to afford such person full enjoyment of the premises  except that in the case of a rental the landlord may where it is reasonable to do so condition permission for a modification on the renter agreeing to restore the interior of the premises to the condition that existed before the modification reasonable wear and tear excepted  2 a refusal to make reasonable accommodations in rules practices policies or services when such accommodations may be necessary to afford such person equal opportunity to use and enjoy a dwelling  or 3 in connection with the design and construction of covered multifamily dwellings for first occupancy after  a failure to design and construct dwellings in such a manner that a the public use and common use areas of the dwellings are readily accessible to and usable by handicapped persons  b all the doors designed to allow passage into and within all premises are sufficiently wide to allow passage by handicapped persons in wheelchairs  and c all premises within covered multifamily dwelling units contain an accessible route into and dwelling  light switches electrical outlets thermostats and other environmental controls are in accessible locations  there are reinforcements in the bathroom walls to allow later installation of grab bars  and there are usable kitchens and bathrooms such that an individual in a wheelchair can maneuver about the space as used in this article the term covered multifamily dwellings means buildings consisting of four or more units if such buildings have one or more elevators and ground floor units in other buildings consisting of four or more units c compliance with the appropriate requirements of the american national standards for building and facilities commonly cited as ansi a1171 or with any other standards adopted as part of regulations promulgated by hud providing accessibility and usability for physically handicapped people shall be deemed to constructed in a manner that affords handicapped persons greater access than is required by this article    persons engaging in discriminatory real estate transactions a unlawful it shall be unlawful application may require disclosure by the applicant of any criminal convictions and the owner or managing agent may require as a condition of acceptance of the rental application that the applicant consent in writing to a criminal record check to verify the disclosures made by applicant in the rental application the owner or managing agent may collect from the applicant monies to reimburse the owner or managing agent for the exact amount of the outofpocket costs for such criminal record check nothing in this article shall require an owner or managing agent to rent a dwelling to an individual who based on a prior record of criminal convictions involving harm to persons or property would constitute a clear and present threat to the health or safety of other individuals g nothing
